I contacted the restaurant and spoke with Peter(The manager), expressing my unhappiness with the customer service I'd received, unfortunately Peter was unprofessional, insincere, while rudely questioning my integrity by saying "I was the first person to complain tonight" then questioned how I ordered the meal Insinuating it was my fault the food was soggy, and that the dry burnt patty was of no concern. Peter didn't appreciate my  business, or really care about my concerns, he then asked for my address so he could forward it to corporate instead of using an in store solution.Due to this Extremely Bad Experience, I will never visit or contact that Portillo's again!!!!

ytDDfe0UlEBGIsRSYhXd3Q.text: It was just good. I had a chili dog and a tamale... the tamale was weird by South West standards... but, pretty good.

6wI0KauKJh8-EAhv0ZlkYQ.text: I had the Portillo's all beef hotdog, it was filling and delicious. I can't wait to come back and try the Italian sausage next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Portillo&#39;s all beef hotdog with fries and a lemonade.

Iqr4N6VmvGNilB_15WdPxQ.text: Nothing to brag about. Not really sure what the hype is all about. The restaurant is loud and chaotic. The elders seem to have a hard time hearing in there. I had the chili cheese dog. I've not had one in years and it seems even coney dogs at Sonic are much better. At least I can say I've tried it.

2B341I1rAIpy751h92xSjQ.text: I had this place bookmarked for months before I finally made it. The place was packed and lines were long, which means it must be worth the wait! I felt a little rushed through the ordering process, but they made it work and it was definitely fast service, which was great because I was on a break from a class across the street. Oh yeah, the seating arrangement was a pain though! The place is huge but not big enough for everyone to sit down, causing people to turn to seat vultures, eyeballing you to hurry it up with your meal they don't have to stand there anymore.  Now the food... It was delicious! I had an Italian beef (dipped plus hot peppers) and a bottle of water. My co-worker was kind enough to share her fries with cheese sauce and I only had a few, but let me be honest in saying I could make a meal out of those! Yum. So, I would be back for the fries alone.  Let me tell you why the two stars and why only the cheese fries would get my business. I was soooo sick to my stomach the rest of the day. I could feel the grease from the "gravy" sitting in my stomach and was belching the taste through the next day. This is not normal for me and so disgusting! Like I said earlier, it was delicious, however, after that bout I am too scared to give the sandwich another shot.

BFLaA-HR1ayiZJDyY65ApA.text: This place is really good! First time coming here and I've only heard good things and I see why! Food is delicious, fast and affordable! Came at around 8 and there wasn't much of a line but the drive through seemed to be getting some good action! Definitely going to come back for sure, get the Chicago!

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This place has some awesome food! Super affordable and really quick too

eySJjwBTFtcSrajwcsKJCw.text: Yo dawg, this place has hot dogs on hot dogs on hot dogs. It started in Chicago and since I've been to Chicago three times in my life I'm pretty much an expert on all things Chicago like da Bears and da Bulls and da Blackhawks. If you come here you can get a hot dog and a bunch of other stuff but don't be that guy, just get a hot dog. That's what they're famous for, and you don't wanna be that guy.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This is my water cup. I&#39;m hung over.

7SneDctuX-IMZDpWwV8Gpg.text: OMG what is this place? And why-oh-why did I discover just as summer in Phoenix is gearing up?  This place is soooo good with amazing customer service. Everything on the menu looks delicious even their salads, but um, so far I haven't "had a chance" to try one -- to preoccupied with these delicious hot dogs and ITALIAN BEEF sandwiches.   Food is super fresh and taste really high quality (for fast food). This is actually the only fast food I will eat. So YUMMMY.   Seriously. This place even has a drive-thru.   Most delicious casual lunch/dinner place in the entire North Scottsdale area. A True favorite.

YSvlbvCZD-KSA1V_85ObNg.text: Ok, here's the thing about Portillo's - the place is a freakin' zoo.  It was a Sunday afternoon...  A hot, muggy, and generally miserable afternoon - to be outside that is.  We had plans to go out for dinner, so we wanted something light for lunch.  Hmmmm, fast food? No. Salad bar? Not today. Oh I know, how about we grab a quick bite at Portillo's  - I hear they have great hot dogs!  And so we went....  First thing I noticed as we approached were the workers standing outside along the drive-thru lane - looking like car salesmen waiting to grab you.  Apparently tho, they are there to assist the massive amounts of cars that come thru - like In N Out.  Next thing I noticed was the large dining area consisting of tables, booths, high tops, and bars.  The 3rd thing I noticed was the massive amount of people and long line to order.   To make a long story short, we had problems finding a place to sit - it was like trying to park and when someone leaves everyone rushes to the vacancy like musical chairs.  We found an uncomfortable bar seat.  As far as the food, it was just OK.  I got the polish and my girl got a regular hot dog.  Both were tasty, yes, but boy were they train wrecks.  Maybe it was a bad day to go, but dining in an overly crowded restaurant, sitting in an uncomfortable bar stool facing the wall while trying to negotiate an OK hot dog falling apart at the seams is only worthy of 2 stars in my book.  I will probably only go back if someone else is treating me.

ODtobLELsuXiB2wpLpmrTw.text: Ever want to know what people from Chicago look like when vacationing in Scottsdale? Well then head on over to Portillo's Hot Dogs and check'em out in all their glory.   Best hot dog you'll ever have, and it's only $3 for a jumbo. it's only the best if you get everything on it. If you're a plain hot dog eater, go to Costco. Their cheese fries are great, but only get them if you like the fake nacho cheese, cause that's what they put on them. I get my beef sandwich "dipped" in gravy, with mozzarella and sweet peppers. You might need a fork and knife, but it's worth it. Skip the chocolate cake shake. IMO, I don't know what the big fuss is over that thing.  Originally they had people from Chicago training the Scottsdale team on how to act like they are from Chicago. Unfortunately, they are (or at least, seem to be) all gone now, so you're left with teenagers trying to pretend like their from Chicago. It's both endearing and awkward.   The location is great and the play great music. A little nostalgia never hurt anyone. I wish they would allow dogs on the patio like Culver's across the street.

BYIlJSDESKzfTPXtbZo2WA.text: This place was the talk around town when it first opened. So, I was looking forward to seeing what the fuss was all about. I was quite disappointed! I, of course, had to get the Chicago dog and it was nothing different than any other Chicago Dog places I have tried around. Maybe, I didn't do the hotdog justice!  I will say that the function of Portillo's is quite unique. It was a tad confusing and overwhelming but once you get the hang of the flow its pretty cool. Definitely a great atmosphere and had awesome customer service.

qXXUzc0DK5cV107J1z1iWg.text: Can't say anything that hasn't already been said, if you're from Chicago or the Midwest in general you know all about the hot dogs and Italian beefs sandwiches the area is associated with. Portillos is the best you're going to get in the valley. Luke's greasy barely flavored sandwiches have always been a sad imitation.  If you're in the area...hell if you're not in the area give this place a try, it's loud and busy but worth it..if the inside noise is too much for you, sit outside it's a lot quieter. And the sandwiches are SUPPOSE to be sloppy...please beware of that before going, us Chicagoans don't eat dry ass sandwiches, I think those are called Philly Steaks.

G0m8s18Jk2eEbQowJClYAQ.text: Starting with the food, it tastes great and I'll go back for it.    That said, I usually order take-out from my car, and way too often they don't get the order right. Today, I ordered a large iced tea with the pink equal, I got neither equal nor a straw. I ordered mustard on my Maxwell Street Polish, missing!  On other occasions, I've ordered the burger with mustard, ketchup, pickle, onion only and gotten lettuce, tomato and mayo, or no onion, or no pickle.  If this kind of sloppy service didn't happen about every other time I go there, I would give them 4 stars.  Come on Portillo's, get your act together!

Pl_ssQprTXcffyk5HrCk_Q.text: Go-to local place (as of now) when I'm craving a good hot dog. The staff is attentive, quick, and social while the place is kept clean. They get very busy around lunch, but not the worst wait time I've experience.

9RzbI5Ap5HpF8bf-m79Vjg.text: The food is great every time. I have gotten the maxwell and beef dog, all good. My wife usually gets the chili cheese dog. Fries are always piping hot and perfectly crispy. They have their soda mixture down pat. The food is flavorful, the fries are hot and the soda sugary! What more could you want? Portillo's is always a sure place to get top notch yummy food if your near by. The only reason I give it 4 stars is because the cashiers can be pretty awkward and make you feel uncomfortable.

XAXZ1QUPo6eOLCC4x5v4vA.text: This place is pretty good.  The hot dogs are probably the best item I've tried, had the chili cheese dog - cheese is a little pasty so I would have it without next time but I enjoyed it otherwise. The regular hot dog is good, they put a ton of toppings on it and it has good flavor.  The burgers are just ok, I like the char broiled flavor but the meat was a little rubbery.  Italian beef was soggy and had a flavor I didn't care for, I think the was the gravy, it had an off/almost artificial beef flavor.  Their onion rings are very good and I love the crinkle cut fries.  I would like to try the tamale in a bowl and their sausage sandwich so I'll be heading back but you can get better burgers/dogs at other places (AJ's supermarket is actually better).  It always seems to be mobbed so they clearly have their fans, to me it's just ok.

Uu2yQ81wm-qGy518Sx8b4A.text: Having lived in Chicagoland for 6 1/2 years, I know Portillo's very well.  Portillo's was never my favorite place to eat Italian Beef living there, but my family really liked it so we went quite a bit.  Now that Portillo's is in Scottsdale (and is coming to Tempe), it might be just about the best Italian Beef in town.  I like their hot giardiniera on a full sized sandwich made dry.  If you know italian beef, you know that even your dry sandwich is going to be soggy.  Ask for it wet and the thing practically falls apart.  I do miss my local italian beef spot that had better choices for bread.  I also miss being able to buy italian beef frozen at Costco in Naperville, IL.  However, living in AZ and not having to withstand the Chicago Winter... I will take Portillo's!   This location is great when there is no rush (think midday).  I have eaten here 4 times and my order has always been correct... even when we placed two to go orders and had a party of six.    If you're ordering chicken... you're doing it wrong.  If you want a "lighter choice," get the chopped salad.  Everyone I know thinks it is AMAZING.  Of course, I don't eat pork but... get it!

2Ol4e_uGwZ9_3ZZaRvxdMw.text: We've eaten in Chicago and had great food, but this place is the worst. Maybe we just ordered the wrong things, but would never go here again.  I got the bbq chicken salad and my husband got the chicken sand. My chicken tasted like a byproduct of hot dog, spam and chicken - absolutely disgusting. I almost hurled. I was so hungry and took the rest of it off the salad just to eat something. The chicken sand felt like a box of air when we took it out of the bag. It was mushy and came with nothing on it. Plus, they wanted $.31 for ranch dressing. You must be kidding me?! The onion rings tasted like frozen rings and the ketchup cups were so small, we couldn't even dip it in anything.  We saw a lot of people got the beef sandwich, and looked good, but will never go here again to even try it. I'll take a bag of Skittles and a Snickers for dinner before I'll visit this place.

-4cCKbz5XzqmYsLQNZQ-yg.text: Italian beef so good you'll cry. This place was packed! And for good reason. Yep it's just that good.

Ec11AFPnbvXeGv90_r8AYA.text: A happy taste of Chicago in my mouth!  As far as I'm concerned it's the best Italian Beef sandwich in AZ.  I always get it dipped with hot peppers and I'm a happy girl.  Their combo with beef and sausage is also great.  They serve Chicago hot dogs the way I remember back home.  Even their cheese sauce for the fries tastes like cheese and not the regular canned toxic cheese.  Yes, the place is loud, yes the place gets crowded.  But I don't care - it's a happy reminder of home for me.  Can't wait until they open their Tempe Marketplace location closer to where I live!

r7xDG4j3nkQjD0XsexgqWg.text: First time eating at Portillos. Service was great and they were very friendly.  Food was awesome.

PLcvknJdt2V-AC_moTY9EQ.text: As a Chicago native, I'm reviewing with that standard in mind. While not bad, this place does fall short a bit. My usual order (for years) has been a hotdog with no tomato and no pepper, a bowl of chili, and fries.  Moving out to AZ, I was sad that I'd only get my Portillo's fix when I flew back to visit family. So when one opened in Scottsdale, I was all over it.  I've been quite a few times at this point.   Hot dog - pretty much as expected. Hasn't let me down.  Chili - gross. I seriously don't know what happened, but it's thicker somehow and lacking something. I tested on my last trip to IL, and it hadn't changed there. It's just bad here.  Fries - hard to mess up. My go-to side.  Onion rings - gross. Super hard, oddly sweet, nothing special.   I use to love the strawberry smoothie, but that's not served here. I did try the chocolate cake shake for the very first time a few days ago and was mightily impressed. I'd never had it before, so I can't compare to IL. While it falls short in a few things, my kids and I have made this our after-zoo spot.   Question though...when on earth did the relish turn neon green? I'm certain it wasn't that color before...?

9zGtq8Tn7-zPMDlVb3uLBQ.text: Today after Church my wife and I decided to stop at Portillo's on Shea for an early lunch.  Prior to placing our order we both went into the restrooms to wash our hands.  I exited first and waited for my wife.  When she exited she walked to the ordering area and requested to speak with a manager. Upon his arrival (Nate) my wife explained that they were out of handsoap in the women's restroom and that she observed an employee in uniform exit the restroom without washing her hands.  The Manager stares  " we have handsantatizers she must have used".  We both watched her go directly to her work  station processing food orders at the food line.  We placed our order and sat down. Once we received our order it was completely wrong and missing items.  I went back to the manager and told him about our order and that we did not appreciate the way he handled my wife's complaint.  The manager stated that he spoke with the employee.  We both know for fact that he did not speak with her as we watched to see if he did.  I understand things happen but when it comes to food safety and health of your guests there is no room for error.  Plus I do not appreciate being lied to by the manager. You lost our business. Businesses need to understand we as consumers have choices as we work hard for our income.  I would encourage others who have had a bad experience here to post your comments.  Other reviews of the establishment show a consistent pattern of poor guest service.

7pC65LOXr3zSo90abvpndw.text: Having grew up on Portillo's, it hurts my heart to post anything negative but feel its necessary in hopes of improvement. The food quality has definitely gone down since the corporate takeover but that's to be expected when you go from an individual owner that grew the business from a humble hot dog stand. That's not my gripe, service is. The general manager Jaime is an unprofessional, unfriendly person that should not be in customer service or a managerial role. Seeing his poor attitude towards customers, it's clear that employees think it's acceptable to be unfriendly as well. This place needs a management change and new friendly faces that appreciate their job and the customers they serve. Save Portillo's!

nFDL5hQ6zniPcPfJv_NLcQ.text: Great Italian sausage and beef! Get it with or without sweet or hot peppers and you will be happy! I recommend getting a combo dipped

ZP2vbG9pOCMU2poLphUtZA.text: First time visit, I enjoyed the food. I had a chili cheese dog and a Jumbo Hot dog, made to order. My friend had a tuna croissant, and fries. I also had a tamale to go, I wasn't expecting much from the tamale, but it was pretty good. Customer service was nice and friendly. I will return in the future. By the way the lemonade was delish.

7AJXuDBOg02UBEMttuotHw.text: We're here at Portillo's now. The food is good quality. My family is enjoying their food - double cheeseburger, chicken sandwich, hot dog, French fries. I ordered the beef and cheddar croissant. It is disgusting. The menu description says it is served on a toasted croissant, but what I got was a sandwich so wet and slimy I couldn't pick it up. It was so wet it resembled uncooked dough. It was inedible. The beef was good, but under seasoned. My husband went to the counter to ask for a new roll. They charged him $.75 for it. I scraped all the pasty, slimy bread off the beef and transferred it to the new roll. That was much better, but now cold. I would never order that again. The first pic is of the wet slimy bread, and the second is with the new roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Charged me $.75 for a new roll, but at least now it is edible.
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wet slimy croissant, yuck!

4Xwn83u22t7UWONHzozrwQ.text: Stopped by ate a hotdog and picked up some Italian beef. It's good but not as good as Chicago Portillos. Service was great and the place was clean! Aping was a sweetie, sorry for ringing the bell so many times!  Aping joined in and made me laugh even more. Recommend stopping by and having lunch or dinner. Catering is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Portillos pick up window
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Aping @portillos

urYjkEmPiBn2OzdneIQQdQ.text: Had the Chicago style hotdog, it was good, with all stuff on it, the bun very soft & chewy. Also had the French fries and the mint chocolate chip malt YUM. (I need to try the strawberry shortcake.) Actually this is my 3rd visit & my 3rd hotdog. I keep bring different friends to this place. It's new to Arizonians.

6hmpUS_j5Up0gYp43VhI8g.text: Service fair.  No management to correct errors.  If a drink is incorrect, the Illinois main office has to rectify it.  "A ship without a rudder".  They don't take care of errors, complaints, or mistakes on premises.  No manager with any authority for corrections on premises.  Very poorly run.  Be cautious.  They sure need the Illinois tourists for this "machine".

ArbTuDu8_3sKHefirFxXQQ.text: This is such a great Chicago place.  Love each their hot dogs and onion rings!! Yum!  Service is fast and efficient.  Thanks Scottsdale for welcoming our Chicago favorite.

blrIJZOAvNmG3GxGQ9Zsyg.text: Check the bag before you drive away at the drive thru!! I can't tell you how many times they forget and we had to drive all the way back to get food or dressing for our salad, super inconvenient. They didn't even apologize or care, kinda sounded like they deal with customers coming back all the time for missed food. One time is understandable but literally this happens all the time. Very annoyed this time

i4xupABpUgbWPydvt7KdWQ.text: Very disappointing...we were looking forward to an Italian Beef sandwich and got a poor facsimile.  While there was adequate amount of beef, there was no 'jus' and no Giardiniera (pickled vegetables) whatsoever, and only two small slices of pepper.   The owners of this specific operation should visit a Portillo's in Chicago to learn how to make this properly.  Better yet, while in Chicago they should get one at Al's on Taylor street. Even the version sold at Gold Coast in Midway airport are better than those offered at Portillo's in Scottsdale.

PWxycIVce_5fFesJIja_3g.text: Portillo's is great Chicago food and they are in Phoenix! Double Italian beef with a chocolate cake shake is the way to go. Now they just need to open in Atlanta. Please come to the Atl, we'll pack the place I promise.

69OZTuGOxiGS2ASO-F2snw.text: The weenie has no flavor. I was only satisfied with the fries. The smoothies are really good.

1i5_77QQki3sKkoXqJQ-Cg.text: Growing up in Chicago and then moving to Scottsdale, I was a huge Portillo's fan when Dick Portillo owned it, but since selling the chain, it has become a major disappointment. The portions of food have greatly diminished - Both the roast beef sandwich and jumbo dog were minuscule, and I can only infer that so too are the other menu items. I won't be coming back - it's on to Al Malnati's for me in the future!

rg21FLgimYChhDYSt7JdTg.text: I was really surprised at how much the family enjoyed this place. It is far from fine dining, but it really hits the spot. The hot dogs are the only thing we have ordered besides the desserts ...also awesome! Their chili cheese dogs are amazing, as are all the others. I love the actual hot dog itself. I don't know where I could buy them, or we would be having them all the time. Everyone ordered a different hot dog, and french fries as well as a dessert, there were no complaints from anyone. If anything, we thought about going back to get another hot dog as one wasn't enough! I would recommend this to anyone who likes an occasional hot dog.

x3arfD3QoDZqjMbJ8eoJuw.text: It's Portillos, what's not to love. Well, the line, but worth the wait. Great food and friendly employees.

CnxBDn1vB8HpuDwORvMg2g.text: Great concepts and the foid is delish.  I can see why so many people come here!  I've had a few things from the menu so far and it's great!!

bxlrDT1ECMzipX0HPitM4g.text: Portillos has always been a great place and a family favorite. However, this time it wasnt so great. We just left having lunch there and while we were waiting for our food the power goes out. Needless to say what we got was far from standard.   My burger was completely burnt and hard with a hard slab of cold cheese. The fries were ok but instead of the coke i ordered i got a rootbeer and was told thats all we've got. I hate rootbeer. My father in laws and fiances food was decent but they didnt get their correct drinks either.   I understand these things happen and sometimes it's out of your control but what is in control is how you handle the situation. You dont tell your customers sorry it's all we've got take it or leave it and you certainly don't have your employees laughing about the situation and commenting about how they can't believe this is the 3rd time this has happened.   If this has happened before i would hope that you would prepare and get some back up generators or something for emergencies like this and it would have been nice if the management gave us a coupon or some sort of discount for next time since we didn't even get what we ordered. Again i love this place and love the food normally. This was an unfortunate situation that was handled extremely poorly.

DZNZt5UtjiVVzDOwWwFRnw.text: It is delicious and the salad's are the bomb when it's dipped it taste like they melt in your mouth

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I am so full the salad is so filling
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Awesome
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

-JDlu9sxE7dnby3HSzayWw.text: Love this place!  Sometimes I just have to splurge!  Chocolate malt and Jumbo hot dog - that's my go to at this spot. Hubby likes their polish best. Great spot before the ASU basketball game!

Mz6CP7Ubbsfv9652lFJC3g.text: Yuuuuuummmm! Needed a quick dinner on my way home to Tucson from a three-hour dance training, so calories were not a concern, other than I needed a lot of them. I did notice they have salads, but can't speak to how good they are, because I came for the hot dogs and cheese fries.  The cashier was friendly, and my to-go order took no time at all. I was out the door for less than $8 with a jumbo Chicago dog, cheese fries, and an iced tea. Everything was delish, and I'll definitely come back next time I'm up this far north!

rW4k01fLhIbx76Yurir4YQ.text: Best Chicago hot dogs in town! This is definitely a Chicago restaurant! I love the poppy seed bun and the pickles, relish, onions, tomatoes ketchup & mustard on it. They also have other food like ribs, burgers, pasta, chicken sandwiches, salads & shakes.   The burger is good, it's not greasy but it needs more toppings some kinda sauce like ranch or something. The breaded chicken sandwich is good. Also got fries they were good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

SaknqoG4M7JtlqCNt9xuUw.text: Love it! This old favorite from Chicago hits the spot every single time! From the crazy-good Italian beef sandwiches (dipped/wet is da bomb for me), to Chi-town dogs dragged thru the garden, tender ribs, crispy fries, desserts, even cold beer to wash it down -- everything it great! My only knock is the sausage it a little mild in flavor. I prefer a spicier sausage with more fennel but, that's a personal preference. We will be back again and again.!!

oIIxWnx-Gjv71e8p0vKl0w.text: Popped in here for lunch with some Chicago-native family who rant and rave about this place. It was packed but tables turned quickly.  I got the Italian beef with hot and sweet pepper mix, onions, and mozzarella and a side of fries. Italian beef was delicious. Fries were good too although a little boring- they're crisp, crinkle cut, and salty.  Ultimately I did like this place and wouldn't hesitate to go back. It just wasn't the destination so many others talked it up to be.

caNCGMJSpx68TVQgGj_9dw.text: This place is a great hotdog experience! Although there are other excellent choices on the menu, the best aspect of this restaurant is those great hotdogs. My favorite are the Jumbo Chicago style or the Jumbo chili- cheese dog! So delicious! The fries are some of the best I've had. Thick and crispy with an excellent flavor. Although I stay away from it, the chocolate cake is also a great attraction. It's a hybrid of a fast food and sit down. Built around the same system as In-N-out, you order at the counter then sit until your number is called out. Fast service and great for the whole family. Must do when in the Phoenix area.

XwNa3dNG5Kw9ke-nzYxgjQ.text: Horrible....I imagine it would have been the worst polish dog but I didn't try it because I did not feel like vomiting. It smelled so bad I haven't been able to get the smell out of my car!

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Polish dog ??
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Maybe a polish dog? Idk

Rj0XAva6zj4Z8t3-f5amkQ.text: This place is AMAZING!!!!!! Our family loves the food! The  the Italian beef, hot dogs, and French fries are our favorite! Would highly recommend!

f4lRW78Jcv-_d65AfV-mTw.text: Got a plain order on both. The drive thru service was not great. Apparently you're supposed to ask for toppings. Everything is a la carte. Spent $20 for plain sandwiches. Meat and bread. Disappointed.

B2f24XcDl9l1o1pPj39iVA.text: I never realized what a Chicago dog was until I wandered into a Portillo's in downtown Chicago over 10 years ago. A decade removed from that memorable Portillo's dining experience, I made a beeline for this location as my first meal after my flight landed in Phoenix. The interior design of the Scottsdale location is way cool and very welcoming. The jumbo dog was as flavorful as I remembered it, and one of my dining guests who had never had a hot dog from Portillo's agreed with me that it's tasty and a few steps above your run of the mill hot dog. The burger was very average and forgettable, and not something I'd order again. The onion rings were perhaps some of the best I've ever had with a very flavorful & crunchy coating. I sampled some of the Portillo's chocolate cake one of the diners had ordered, but found the cake to be nothing special and the frosting a bit too sweet. They have a vast menu including a multitude of pastas, salads, and desserts, so I can't wait to try out some of their other menu items, but I know the dogs and onion rings are a must. Hopefully another decade doesn't pass by until my next Portillo's dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Interior
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Onion Rings
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheeseburger

OKBo862PRB96-PEBNDXK4A.text: We were in Gilbert AZ with my in-laws sitting around the pool and couldn't decide what to eat.  We have too many kids, so cost was definitely an issue. We wanted some variety to keep everyone happy. We decided on Portillo's Hot Dogs.   I had their original Chicago style hotdog and a simple Caesar salad. I loved it all!  Everything was so fresh and delicious. My brother and sister in-law both had burgers and raved about how great they were. Some of the kids ordered chicken tenders, spaghetti and the original hotdog. Everyone was happy and the prices were VERY reasonable. I can't wait to go again!

puEvJRDWqQNeG429D_o2eg.text: Last time I had this was in Chicago, and remember how good it was.  However we didn't eat dinner here because I wanted healthier options, but my son remembered the chocolate cake shake from hearing about it on Gabriel Iglesias comedy show. So we went to get some shakes! We got a couple of chocolate cake shakes to go. We did have our dog with us and this place has a huge patio, you would like it would be appropriate for pet owners to bring their pups, but no. There was a sign on the door that clearly stated no dogs on patio. How disappointing!  The shake on the other had wasn't disappointing. It was really good and you get a decent amount for the price. Try the shake, you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. We were disappointed at this because we had our dog with us. You have a patio!!

W9xzzaarMec7fIPKObpEOw.text: UPADTE: Customer relations, not going well.  EVERY ORDER we have gotten to go has been wrong/ a mess.  Training might help?  Since the prices are not reasonable for this kind of service. Try placing food in a tray?  Great food, wish we had better experiences.  The food here is by far the closest you will get to eating in Chicago!  Their salads are phenomenal as well as the hot dogs (of course).  The only problem seems to be getting the orders right...  Third time using the drive threw, and the third time the order was not correct after waiting over 20 minutes for the food. All in all, it's a great place to eat, but checking your order for accuracy is certainly a must when visiting this particular location.  Maybe a little review with the friendly staff and management may help fix this little issue.

dmkT9kuw76QoUZGeXDOVPA.text: This shithole is run by white trash jack holes who couldn't care less about quality.  Scummy, scummy people running the shit show.  I ordered a burger today and the single tomato that was on my burger was an end slice with a nice big, hard stem stalk in the middle.  WTF?!  Scummy, dirtbag, trashy people who don't give a fuck running this pathetic establishment.

nh1qIEj54Q2KDq2ljTAzpA.text: Always a good taste of Chicago. My bf and I got the beef and cheddar cheese croissant with sweet and spicy peppers with cheese fries. This place has several menu items to choose from and for a fast food place is pretty cool inside and plenty of places to sit. It was about $20 for both of us so not bad. One of our favorite quick bites to eat at!

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZV7KKdELLVunj6IFMSWGrw.text: Times change as do people's taste and tolerance.  Had lunch here (Scottsdale) with my wife today and realized we had changed, gotten older, with reduced noise tolerance and a deeper understanding of flavor. Sorry Portillos, your recipes have changed, as has the quality of your ingredients.  We both ordered the breaded chicken club sandwiches, which contained skimpy and small fried chicken-breast cutlets, which at best covered perhaps two-thirds of the small bun and included two thin pieces of undercooked bacon.  The crinkle cut fries were excellent! My wife thought the frozen strawberry shake was wonderful.  The noise level was unbearable.  A pulsating and very loud mix of music and voices disrupted my digestion.  We ate as quickly as possible in order to get out. The staff were efficient and friendly and kept the many tables cleared. Three stars are generous.  We probably won't return.

c2200KhTEg4QKRR3HUj7KQ.text: As a native Chicagoan and someone who has been eating at Portillo's since they were a shack on the side of the road, I had to take a couple stars off this location's review.  I've been here a few times and every single time I ordered my fries crispy only to receive regular, hardly crispy at all fries.

tG65dpWREp0anHQmm27yYA.text: We are in Phoenix for the day, and all day my friend was craving Portillo's.  It did not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Logo

4MDZ7_ie3XhA1tCCy6B6Cw.text: Really don't review after one visit, but this place is legit. Fresh food, friendly staff, very clean and fast service. I had sausage and beef with gravy. Holy oh my wow, what a treat! I will be back and they have a drive thru too.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sausage and beef

5oxBGRrkTb_owU9uU457xA.text: I visit this restaurant frequently. When I go in and order there are no problems. But the drive thru is different.  I ordered and paid for a cheeseburger. And when I got home had chili fries. I filled out the survey but really do not expect anything to come from it. I guess I'm out $5 and a half bucks

ezEMKE5jt0c5QbFRDb7Zug.text: One of our favorite places in Chicago to take people to get a decent Chicago Dog when visiting. Their hamburgers are pretty good too. Not to mention it's hard to pass up those yummy cake milkshakes. We love the atmosphere and the family friendly aspect of the place.

TfFY7SQrj9kzGR4z6UNpBA.text: We have been to Portillos in the Chicago area many times & are never disappointed, so when we saw they had one in Scottsdale, we jumped at the chance to go not once, but twice, while we were in the Valley.   We were not disappointed at all.  We felt like we were back in Chi-town!  The Italian beef was as great as ever, then I saw that they have a "combo" sandwich with Italian sausage & beef together!  So I asked my brother who lived in Chicago about this & he said that's all he ever gets!  So we came back a second time & I had that & OMG - it's heavenly!   I also had their chocolate cake shake!  Maybe it's the "kid in me", but it reminded me of when you were having cake & ice cream & you mix them together! One tip - when you order, hang close to the pick up counter, they DO NOT call order numbers in exact order & it's quite boisterous in there, so you can miss your number (which on the first visit, we did & I'm pretty sure someone took our order).  They quickly made it for us again, but lesson learned, the 2nd time, I stayed close & made sure to grab our order as soon as it came up!

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Look for this!
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The chocolate cake shake!
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The &#34;Combo&#34; Italian sausage &amp; Italian beef together!

vrRJ6Uzjg-tgBOYPWPsMmQ.text: Of the last 4 visits to this Portillo's, 3 of my orders have been incorrect. That's right a 75% error rate in topping or counting hot dogs! It's actually worse, as sometimes they'll make multiple mistakes, just to keep things interesting.   If you're eating at the restaurant, they'll fix the problem but certainly don't count on a good attitude about it, and don't expect an apology silly customer! If you're ordering at the drive through, you'd better unwrap and inspect your food before leaving to ensure you got what you ordered. Topping hot dogs is complicated stuff after all, apparently so is counting.  Food is OK, apparently brings back memories for Chicago transplants. But the unengaged, unhappy staff screams poor management that can't be overcome by any amount of nostalgic signs and photos and makes for a poor dining experience. Do yourself a favor and look at other Chicago style hot dog restaurants on Yelp, you'll find some that serve great food, with a great attitude, served by happy people who can both top hot dogs AND count !

XrkjeC1VDhgfGZHoX0qC_g.text: All I can say is... If I die from clogged arteries tonight, I want my family to go after Portillos. Ordered some hotdogs (got them char grilled... Took 20 minutes longer, after we were told it would be 10 extra minutes, than a Normal cook would have been) but I think it make them better, raising them to an "ehh" level. Also got the Italian beef, regular gravy. Now my idea of gravy is, well, something brown and maybe beefy tasting or like an Au jus type sauce. This sandwich was pure grease. My husband and I tried to eat it, really wanted to like it, but couldn't do it... It was dripping in tasteless grease and made me feel nauseous. I don't get the rave reviews this place gets. Yuck.

KgHi27oUXfHgirh08LS2Ug.text: Went here today for the first time. My wife had been here before and did nothing but talk it up. So, I gave in and tried it. The food was too greasy and when we ordered the fries, I opened the bag and went to grab them out, but instead, I grabbed a line of staples. I brought it up to the manager's attention. I didn't care too much about it, but that could've been dangerous if a child had gotten that bag of fries. But, I've had better food than here. I don't think I'll ever go back.

02AffSO9GCFfOXXi2XXEaQ.text: I've tried their rib dinner for the 1st time...DO NOT BOTHER!! stick with the dogs, beef and burgers.  Being from Chicago, I expected a different or chicago style rib.. instead a got a cold, mushy, too sweet, fall off the bone rib that I couldn't stomach.. plus a small order of fries and a tiny paper cup of coldslaw on a paper plate and plastic fork and knife...management was  kind or smart enough to comp my dinner. My observation is that for the price they are charging for their "full slab" dinner.. for a few bucks more at Don and Charlies, you can get a real Chicago style full slab, a bowl of coldslaw, unlimited fries, a big  bread basket, white tablecloth, real silverware and plates and the ambience of a great sports hall of fame restaurant.  I love Portillo's, been eating there for 25+ years.  I was so disappointed in their ribs.  Never again.  Stayin with the dogs, beefs and their salads are great too.

YWmFZBnjwE_qIwV45JhLOg.text: This place ROCKED. Everything was absolutely delicious. The loaded hot dogs were so good and the homemade relish was really good too.  We also tried the chili dog and the chili was just meh. Awesome cake shakes too!

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great food and kids friendly

mTdOgNalZuQ3PbeefC95xg.text: SO good! I was visiting my boyfriend that was living in Arizona, and he insisted on bringing me to Portillo's, he knew I was going to love it! I had never heard of it before because I from Montreal. I had hands down one of the best beef sandwiches in my life. It had these tasty hot peppers too. I enjoyed the crinkle cut fries as well, very yummy (but very fattening!). Definitely a must have if you are around!

AALttspfkyaFTua_QE4SXg.text: A throw back dining establishment great food and atmosphere. Casual and fun it is so much more than dogs. I ordered chili dogs and fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Order up

wsuy_PYQ_gMOdqRGz-rhUQ.text: What can I say, I love Portillo's. My favorite dinner here is an Italian beef (prime roast beef, soaked in au jus type sauce) sandwiched between pillows of the softest bread imaginable and then dunked again into sauce. It's amazing, and messy, but mostly amazing.  Also, the cheese fries are de-lish. I normally am anti-fake-liquid-cheese, but this cheese is like a creamy bowl of macaroni and cheese sent from heaven to dip your perfect french-fries in; a dangerous combination!  The chocolate cake is delicious. I also love the chocolate cake shake -- chocolate shake with chocolate cake crumbles. Yum, yum, yum! Naomi Garnice gives it two thumbs up!!

d4XbgqTcDi3k2KtfxlOeAw.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  Its just about as good as Chicago!!  I'm so glad!  Even the workflow is the same, they take orders before you get to the register and your food is ready in no time.  Its awesome!  PLUS because we're not in Chicago they even have a nice patio area so you can enjoy your food outside!  Pricing's the same too!  SO HAPPY!

63-BLeTtCG0aGjTbfFLmPg.text: Get the large beef sandwich dipped with peppers and all is good in the hood!! The manager chatted us up while waiting in line as first timers, the atmosphere is fun and the food callers keep you entertained. Was my 1st time but won't be my last, we got beefs, dogs, fries, and rings and it was tasty!

1eRcSBKtQlUmaLfEYFNDgA.text: So I haven't had the hotdogs but the burger was a hit! Very delicious flavor and I asked for a side of their gravy (sauce) to dip my burger.....gosh I can just drink that stuff it's so good!

T6bkpmQTTB9xlCmCESxV0w.text: Portillos is the bomb dot com! So glad you guys made it here to AZ. Always good food, friendly people.

oRByhlDkPCySmJVZNT-32w.text: I really don't understand what all the hooplaa (a teynical term) is about. We stopped in for a quick lunch with the parents last week and we were less than impressed. We enjoyed what we ordered, but I wouldn't drive more than 5 minutes to eat there.   I had a chopped salad, it was alright, the dressing was good, but too much of it. My hotdog bun was pretty much wet. Everyone said the was because it had been in a steamer or something... if this is what people in Chicago call a good hot dog, they must not get good food often. I guess the Italian Beef is what all the rage was about, but none of us partook in any of the beef sandwiches, maybe we will give it a whirl next time.   I also don't get the drive through right next to the patio like that..... yeah that's just what I want with my sandwich a lung full of exhaust fumes. Awesome!  All in all it was alright foo.... but I wouldn't go out of my way.

Mk0PmEtt6Ie5Dhwzfg20Vg.text: Totally worth it.  Sunday afternoon, no line worth mentioning.  Found a booth inside.  Great fries, great Italian beef.  Cake to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The real deal!

zqsPbYwkdVxEJy0A-_UhVA.text: This place is the BEST! All the food is great! We always get the big beef and split it because its huge! The chocolate cake shake is sooo good! We love the service and environment here! Totally worth the drive! Friendly staff and clean eating areas! We love portillos!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qUun2mB_bQ7MLB8LcDCfjw.text: After leaving an event that didn't fill me up tonight, the BF and I went to Portillo's since we hadn't tried it yet and were right there! Well.....the food was better than the place we left, but it was nothing special. I had a hot dog and was disappointed that they didn't use Vienna beef and that they did not have neon green relish....those two things are what make a Chicago style hotdog in my book. The BF enjoyed his cheeseburger, I thought it was pretty par as far as cheap cheeseburgers go. I definitely would not drive all the way out here to eat again, but I wouldn't refuse to eat here either, so I suppose it is ok.

0f-2jUyFRLvK2e3Qf6cv5A.text: we knew about Portillos from our many travels to Chicago so we were excited to here they were opening one here and not too far from where we live. been here twice now and every time its crazy busy!! the location is perfect right off the 101 and Shea so its easy to get to. The people are friendly and the wait wasn't too long considering how packed it was.   We had a plain hot dog for my 2 year old, chili cheese dog with onions (sooo good), a bacon burger which was great just be careful not to leave it in the container it comes it mine got super soggy. Italian beef sandwich was also good pretty much anything we tried was great!   for dessert we got the chocolate cake and strawberry milk shake both were yummy!!   will definitely be coming back wish it was just 5 minutes away but worth the extra drive

H5Gz-sGFvX_TWGtpRLq9HA.text: Growing up in and around the Chicago area, I am ashamed to admit that it took this landmark eatery's expansion to Arizona for me to walk in the door.  The wife and I decided that our Sunday Fun-day wouldn't be complete without a Chicago Dog, Italian Beef and Rings...I should probably mention that we split a Chocolate Cake Shake too.  The employees are very "Chicago", filled with personality and attitude, all working for a seemingly competent and well managed organization to boot.  The interior was very clean, it appeared that they have numerous employees who's function it  is to quickly clean up tables as guests pick up their trays to depart.  Many other restaurants come to mind that should take note.  On to the food:  the Hot Dog was, well a Hot Dog.  Delicious in it's own right, but a Hot Dog nonetheless.  One discerning characteristic comes to mind, the poppy seed bun.  Fresh, almost spongy, not soggy.  Italian Beef was the best of recent memory, possibly knocking Mr.Beef (666 N Orleans St, Chicago IL) off of my #1 spot.  Ordered it wet with hot peppers.  Serving was proper, plenty of meat, bread that was moist and retained much of the Au Jus.  Purely Fantastic!  Onion Rings were delicious, not too thick,  the batter is unique in its texture, much crispier than I remember rings typically being.     Chocolate Cake Shake: two things I am not 1) A fan of chocolate 2) A fan of shakes. How can two things that I like so little, taste so good?  A must for all visitors.

KPjbkwhTlTcS8_qEOVj9PQ.text: The "Combo" Italian beef/sausage was no joke!   Italian beef was absolutely AMAZING...  My only gripe, French Fries were ice cold. :(

P7Fo2H4hVXbn4iUKKfpkIg.text: Who would've known amongst the raging heat of a Phoenix summer there'd be a Portillos!?! It couldn't be further from Chicago...but the two Chicago dogs and friendly staff lived up to the standard...right down to rhyming order numbers " 188 don't be late your food is ready"...this place rocks

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

FtIeLzYQL-uuIXQcIRicuw.text: Awesome dogs!  Just like I remember from the downtown Chicago location.  Beers a bit limited though.  But, the dogs .....!

RuvwRMCILLqUnwOwX6sctA.text: Ate a few hotdogs from this location. Same as the one in Tempe. So that's good!  Amazing menu with Chicago style food. The service is decently fast but I think it's the taste that matters at Portillos. Still haven't tried the entire menu. I have tried hotdogs, tamales, and sausages. Still debating if I want to try their salads and fancy burgers. Somehow, I associate this place with hotdogs.  Anyway, it's not healthy. At least the hotdogs and sausages but extremely delicious! If you are looking for fast food, this is the place. Skip the other chains.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Maxwell street Polish dog

dTAhIE4JEZUkqiw_HF9s2Q.text: Brings back memories of eating at Portillo's and other beef/hotdog places in Chicago and Phoenix as a kid. Love it! Can't go wrong with a char dog. It will take a little longer, but worth it. The beef, double dipped, is fantastic, as is their chocolate cake.

yMt_Tw075CFNm-gk-6hFBQ.text: A Chicago staple closer to the west coast. We visited from CA and needed to stop in to have a bite to eat. Italian beef sandwich was great and i had the meatball salad and that was very good.

7uYxK8BE0yI8sp4p4_jKYw.text: The burgers and salads are also great in case you're not in the mood for hotdogs. Everyone enjoyed their food except for one that had average ribs, nothing special. Our friend from Chicago loved his beef sandwich. I would definitely come here again in a heart beat and I don't think I'm alone on this.   If you like Chicago style hotdogs you must eat here if you're in the Phoenix area.

KvJotOfcId3a5iFpCa2GVg.text: First time trying Portillos on the 28th of may (yesterday) it was really good! I got a jumbo hotdog with grilled onions, relish, celery salt, cheddar cheese and a baked potato. Really nice servers and good quality food! If your craving a hot dog this is the place to be!

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jumbo dog and potato

gyhUTM7iUm_hJuJvnZruIQ.text: Atmosphere is very casual, and if you aren't familiar with the menu, your first time will require you to take a few minutes to process the myriad choices available to you (Italian beef, Italian sausage, hot dog, chili dog, chicken tenders, fried halibut, fries, with cheese, and/or without chili, hot peppers, sweet peppers, chocolate cake, or strawberry milkshake, you name it, and this Midwest restaurant favorite may make you miss home...  Takes me back to my days working at Barney 's Ribs (another Portillo brand).  Oh, and everything is a la carte!  Mom enjoyed her chili cheese dog, ate it all, and even though she suffered tremendous pain from the onions and beans, she wanted to have another one the next day!  (I told her maybe once-a-week is a better option- too much sodium, you know.)  The beef was good, but I didn't really care for it in a croissant, as I prefer eating crispy, flaky layers, and not the soggy mess I had for lunch.  There also wasn't much cheese, except in the corners of the roll.  Will never order it again!    $0.60 for two strips of roasted hot peppers is a bit much...

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beef and cheddar croissant.
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jumbo chili cheese dog.

7T9_od7lQqMTr5SKeK6fGQ.text: I love going to Portillo's! I used to come here twice a week when I lived close by. I usually don't like when places have a large menu, but I think it works great here. I can always find something to eat when I am dieting or indulging in a cheat meal. I hope they decide to open a location in central Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love the onion rings!
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hot dog with mustard and ketchup
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummy cheese fries

XSQ07awjstjwVtFT_sY1Hg.text: This place sucks now that Don doesn't own it. The food simply isn't the same. Portillo's has the best beef in town before the change in owners. Went and had dinner their last night. I ordered the cheeseburger and fries. The cheese burger was Luke warm, cheese just thrown on there. Fries were awful, not fresh felt like they fried them, took them out when they got old and refried them... I ordered an Italian beef as well for lunch tomorrow and tried that and it was just as awful. Not the beef ths

KR-sP4D2wxSrW4jDD7mLjw.text: We were visiting AZ and we always try to hit restaurants we don't know. This was our last "try out" before heading back to TX. The hot dog are average, can do those at home any day. I had their chicken Tuscan salad which was delicious. My husband got their chicken Parmesan and enjoyed it very much. I would go back and recommend it, to be honest I don't think their hot dog is their best option on the menu, but I'll leave that entirely to you. We enjoyed our food a lot.

WDlOQyc-1jgUZKiPPMzLuA.text: Screwed up my order again. For the number of employees there you would think they will get a simple order right. They even miss  the drink!

cTUPb1PpagDf-SvFQcfxjw.text: A great place to take a family. The menu has a huge variety and good pricing. Five of us were able to have a meal for under $30!

kIFN975cgVp8rZItu15j6g.text: $0.60 for peppers on my Italian Beef!  Soggy bread and meat with no flavor. Did not live up to all the hype. Probably won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. $.60 for peppers and this is what you get. Notice the soggy bread.

Z5aEne3TLmsFx8dN7E4UZQ.text: Great atmosphere and customer service! However, I ordered the beef and cheese croissant and the bread was really soggy, too much beef and very little cheese. I would come back but order something different.

Kef-H35rDUBaLpvWkYC49A.text: Couldn't wait to visit, very familiar with the chain as we frequented it often downtown Chicago. Food is still good but just seems like something has changed that is why I didn't give it 5 stars.

Lwq4uiuUkrry8Gd3NS1pQw.text: Our last few drive thru orders have been disappointing. Missing food (each time our orders of cake were omitted, even after asking to be sure they were there), cold chicken sandwiches and missing cheese for our cheese fries.

Lt0SaU2U4cGJKUtNuYnnNw.text: Portillo's isn't just hot dogs!  It is so much more!  I had the halibut fish sandwich and onion rings. Hot and crispy (both) very flavorful. They even have soup and I love soup almost any time of year!  Staff pleasant and when they call your number this server put a little poetic twist based on the last number of your order. Clever. We chose to go outside. It was a beautiful day. Besides, while the music was great (loved the genre) it was terribly loud inside. You can hear the music outside but at a lower tone so you could hear each other talk. Not a True complaint because now I know I won't be a stranger just some constructive criticism. Maybe others are okay and I  am just an old fuddy duddy. Oh well. I can always get it to go if I want. They also cater so now another place to consider for an office lunch. I also noticed special Lenten sandwiches.

zSMJ-oxDPQIwdVz9BR71EQ.text: OMG, OMG from my very own Chicago! A size of Chicago with real Chicago dogs & the wonderful chopped salad.   Every town needs a Portillos! Their Chicago dogs are authentic including the bright green relish!  The chopped salad is exactly as we get it in Chicago.   And the sweet people who clean up after you. Surely makes me miss Chicago.

J0YnQIsNGUhz6FHEwDYrWQ.text: Amazing place truly felt like a visitor on my 1st time there but overall great place, the italian beef sandwich was great i recommend this place to anybody and of course the Chicago families; )

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The waiting area
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing place

MVdKMIhZlJE-duFPn3aKog.text: This place was a BLAST! I have been visiting Scottsdale for a month. I'm from Charlotte. This place reminds me of Pinkies which is in uptown Charlotte.   My sister took me here because she knows I'm a fan of places that have a diner vibe to them. This place has some tasty food options. Lots to choose from. The staff was super friendly. We took a while to order but no one was behind us so it was all good!   I decided to get the mushroom burger with pasta salad. My sister ordered chicken fingers with onion rings. We both got shakes. She ordered the chocolate shake and I ordered the chocolate cake shake. Everything was AMAZING. The food was cooked in decent timing. My sister had to pick up her food at one counter where as I had to pick it up at another. Weird set up but that doesn't affect much.   The chocolate cake shake was weird but I couldn't stop drinking it. Everything was great and I would highly recommend this place to anyone who lives here and even those who come to visit. Can't wait to come back and eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

tuooLGmrHs_-meaHQxSfgQ.text: From amazing to more lame each time. I remember several years ago when you could go to Portillo's and feel like it was a quality place to eat some amazing Chicago style food.   Nowadays it's just another place to eat. Heck, somedays I'd prefer McDonald's over them. Such a sad loss of quality.   Dipped sandwiches were dipped. And I mean held down and made soggy. The way they should be. Not anymore. Now if the sandwich touches the gravy it is momentarily at best. Dry, unwet bread that is just not the same.   I've talked to team members, hosts, assistant managers, managers, GM's, and even Directors based in Chicago. All offer the same lame apologies and promises to do better next time.   Nothing changes. No improvement. Zero.   I was once a Portillo's fanatic. Spending hundreds of dollars a month there. Now I barely go once a quarter and am still consistently disappointed with their quality.  \_()_/  if it doesn't matter to them...

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huge eating area!
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Portillo&#39;s in ARIZONA?!  I&#39;m full again!

SaOF_03nLTqHCmF5-TsoLA.text: I never give anything a 1 star but honestly I wish I could give this place a big fat zero.   We are vegetarian and EVERY single time in the past 3 months we have gone through the drive through at this place.....we get home and our order is wrong. Teach your staff what a vegetarian eats.....NO MEAT....its not that hard.  This last time we got home after ordering simple spaghetti with marinara and it had meat sauce.  Not coming back.   You guys are unorganized and just not worth the drive.  Looking at recent reviews you also have a huge customer service issue with both the employees and manager(s)...great representation of your company!

wmiTnUzLs3oTya3TI-UsXQ.text: Really good service for the most part. The girl at the counter gave me some attitude when I asked for a refill but everyone else was so nice that I'm looking past it haha. This location is far less crowded than the Tempe location too. Has a better parking situation and just as spacious as the Tempe one

wCTEg0Ragl_srsyyzrl6hg.text: I've been here a couple Of times and can say that I like the food fairly well. That said, I don't really understand Chicago food mentality. People stand in long lines here to get soggy roast beef and Giardiniera pepper sandwiches. .   Idk. I'm not from Chicago. But like I said. It's fairly good. I just don't get the "fuss".   As far as the hot dogs go, the dogs at the cart at Home Depot are my go to. And no long lines.  I can't care for the burgers here at all.   Honestly, places like this sort of annoy me. Or rather their crazed fans do. No. Chicago is not the only city that "knows how to make a sandwich". Or a pizza. Get over yourselves.   In fact, if you all love Chicago so much, what are you doing here?  My one Chicago friend was always complaining about how everything in Arizona is so terrible. So. You know what she finally did?  She moved back!

x823lMD4rs0lCEMuaaF3Og.text: This place is so fun!  The moment you walk in the door I felt like I went back in history to another era. Portillo's has classic photos and signs on the wall showing the history of Portillo's. Even the staff wear classic looking uniforms- I like it.  You can order food in drive thru, get it delivered through door dash or go inside (lots of seating inside and outside on patio) and sit down for a meal. You order your food first and then wait until your number is called to pick it up at the counter.  I saw families, veterans, seniors, couples- all ages during my visit. This is a great place for everyone.  I got the classic Portillo's dog- it was just perfect and came with colorful toppings and the best dill pickle.  On the side I got onion rings- so crispy.  We will be back- nothing bad to say about our visit, this was a great first experience.

RKcxDJRiOdBKNT0L72HVYQ.text: Great beef sandwich's! Great dogs! Great fries! Italian beef with hot pepper & mozzarella cheese dipped!

pys7qQztuOlOv9GMS-Eu3Q.text: Place is very clean and food is wonderful. It's a bit pricey but you pay for what you get, and it's good!

H0LCrXajbIbaPZJq0OwS-g.text: Great place and reminds me of sweet home Chicago. Problem is they started offering delivery and ITS HORRIBLE. We have tried it three times and like the Cubs in most years, they struck out. The first time was to my office. We got the wrong order, so the delivery guy went back to get our order. I thought he was going back to Portillo's, he went back to where he dropped the wrong order and the brought it to us. We opened to find one sandwich with a bite out of it. GROSS.  Gave it another chance last week and after an hour it never showed and we had to cancel as daughter was hungry (delivered to wrong address) Third time was tonight and while our order was correct, it was cold and our "large fries" were half empty. Guess the driver was hungry. Anyways, Portillo's rocks, but their delivery partner is the WORST. Sorry, but Portillo's- you are out.

0ZZNiU4dXM5BObYnpe3w8w.text: As part of Chicago in the desert this is a staple of the Windy City cuisine. This trip focused on their barbecue rib offerings. With a sweet yet tangy sauce and cooked to perfection, these ribs were fall of the bone delicious. I ordered online and picked them up. After driving a half hour and being late to pick them up-sorry guys- they were kept perfectly hot. Wrapped in foil and placed gently in a thick cardboard box made just for them which included extra sauce and a couple wet naps. The only reason a star was removed was is the pick up counter is not manned and it took a while for anyone to notice I was there. Otherwise this would have been a perfect visit.

DlTegEs3YenJNGBOYkwxJw.text: I love Chicago dogs and that is what Portillo's does best. The poppy seed bun is fresh and steamed. The Dogs are steamed and hot all the way through. All the trimmings are kept nice and cold and they are super fresh and crispy. I did notice a lack of celery salt on my last dog though.  The restaurant is kept clean and the service is pretty fast. The pricing is pretty reasonable for quality ingredients.

vWoxrYSbxLb06cRgH9xf5Q.text: Can never go wrong with a dipped Italian Beef!  Also be sure to get a Chocolate Cake Shake.  Great location that has the look and feel of the Downtown Chicago location but with a lot less chaos.

lSb7kOEEm5m-drQaCBtpVg.text: This is a great place! It's unusual and cool, service is good, food is real good and it's a fun place!  Atmosphere: there's a lot to see in this place, keep your eyes open and keep them constantly moving and you might see about 20% of everything that covers the walls and ceilings. It's really very cool, great casual vibe, colorful and visually stimulating. Because of the hard floors, large windows, wooden chairs and tables and other hard surfaces, it's kind of loud, but in a good, exciting, fun, upbeat way. The seating area is large, spacious and open, even though the place can get packed, there are plenty of seats and it can feel kind of fun to be sitting among the masses. If you're looking for a place to sit off to the side, you can usually find that also. But, it does depend on the time of day, this place gets packed. Of course, half of Chicago lives here, so what would you expect  (if confused, i'll explain, Portillo's is a Chicago institution)  Service: I have always found the service people here to be pretty friendly, you occasionally get the bland-human, but you'll find them occasionally everywhere. For the most part, the people behind the counters are either relatively friendly, smiling and taking your order, or running around like mad-men (and yes, mad-women), filling orders for the masses waiting in the dining area for their grub. It is kind of funny when the place really gets hopping and you see a single employee trying to manipulate lines of 40 and 50 people each waiting to order, a bit like herding cats and their frustration can be mildly amusing.  Food: I'm kind of a sucker for sticking with what I love, so for me, it's always Chicago hotdogs and fries. If you know you'll love it, why take a chance, right? Fortunately for me, I've been with plenty of other people who have ordered other things and their food always looks delicious and as I am eating their leftovers, I've always enjoyed them too . I find the food here excellent. It's high-quality, served fresh and temperature appropriate, large portions, great value and the taste is excellent. It's clear that ingredients are quality.  The business is clearly all about the food and the experience, a great thing!  Yup, I definitely recommend Portillo's. It's not going to be a first choice for a formal business meeting or coming here before prom or anything (although, how cool would that be???), but for just about any other "eating out" occasion, it's a terrific stop and you'll be glad you did.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Greek salad with chicken, fries, rings and a couple of Chicago dogs, yummy!
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside, open, bright, cool, retro.

DLfjNxyJFPLARSttHcKI3A.text: My family and I have been coming to Portillo's for many years in Chicago. We have have been to the Tempe location and to this location in Scottsdale numerous times. We have always had wonderful food and mostly good service util today. We placed our order which included a chopped salad. The lady at the salad counter was so freaking rude. We needed a  lid and she just ignored us. We ended up just reaching around and getting our own.  We also ordered cheese fries, which we always do, and they forgot the cheese. No big deal but they forget it 80% of the time. It's just annoying.  We also ordered plain iced tea. It was rancid. We took a sip and my husband and I just threw it away.   Also, I ordered the flounder sandwich. It was disgusting. I usually get the grilled tuna which I love but wanted to try something new, I'm so sorry I did.   We truly love Portillo's, we drove 40+ minutes just to go there. This trip was just so disappointing. When you look forward to some awesome food, it's a major let down when it sucks.

7Cq6meJ8EAvR4TIN90dmig.text: Some good results in the salad department as I cruised through the drive through pretty quickly. The chop salad is very filling and has nice white chicken chunks, some pasta, lettuce and cabbage etc. Every bite was really good and try the raspberry dressing as well.  Drinkwise I tried the frozen strawberry lemonade and that was delicous. It stayed frozen as well for at least 30 minutes. They also give you a small slice of bread with your salad and some coupons for your next visit.

EEEy38Hr6-Xr0qOAhoROXA.text: Did drive thru a couple of weeks ago and the order got messed up: chocolate cake was missing. Called and was on hold for 14 minutes to speak with a manager. Once he finally came on the line, his response was along the lines of "oops, but you can get it next time." That's not okay, so I asked for better - like a gift card. Begrudgingly he agreed and promised to put one in the mail for a mere $10.  Two weeks later and nothing has arrived. Disappointing, sloppy customer service. Next time I'll go across the street to Chick-fil-A where the service is top notch - and the food great, too.

59vdCgAeXE-vkDAUASpmRQ.text: I lived in Chicago until I came to Arizona for college, lived here since 1979.  Worked at hot dog restaurant  in high school.  At first I was delighted to be able to go to Portillos but I'm tired of over cooked hot dogs, wet buns, small portions of Italian beef and mistakes on my order.  It's still ok, but they screw up  so often and don't pay attention to details.  Check your order twice before you leave. Tonight I went and once again they messed up my order. Portillos is the single worst restaurant for takeout. EVERY order I place for takeout is wrong I've decided I'm going to take pics of my receipt and my order. Post them here for your viewing pleasure. But you know what really pusses me off? They never offer to pay for my dinner or offer any compensation. Tonight I asked them to remake my order, which the manager agreed too. Your customer service sucks

Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Portillos receipt with wrong order AGAIN
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cub die hard

N9Ovo9Jv3zJKmWpe7gJapw.text: I haven't stepped into a Portrillo's in over 20 years since I was a Chicagoland resident; so imagine my elation when my wife and I ate here for an early dinner the other day.     ...but sometimes memories fare better than the reality. Maybe I've been going to local restaurants too much but when I asked if they had military discount, stickers or WIFI the answer was a resounding NO. We ordered a full rib dinner, chicken caesar salad and drinks anyway.  How it went:  The Chicken Caesar Salad: Good, I mean crispy lettuce and all but the takeaway was it was a little dry.  The Full Rib Dinner: Very good. The sauce, different from what we're used to (it tasted lemon-based or something) but the meat was falling-off-the-bone delicious. The fries and baked potato were average good. The coleslaw side...I think KFC makes a better one. We split a strawberry shortcake for dessert; also nice. The strawberry shake I ordered was also good but not like I remembered in the past (but is ANYTHING the same as 20 years ago?).     Despite the negatives, we'll probably visit again if only to try the famous hot dog.     Worth checking out...again!

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry Shortcake
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Full Rib Dinner...with fixin&#39;s

yoej0uWOT5j9B2mDRVA5IA.text: The food here is decent. It's good, filling, decently priced, and an overall great place to come to if you are with family. It's nothing out of the ordinary, just standard comfort food (I.e burgers, pasta, fries, etc.). However even though the food is standard, the shakes are what blows everything out of the water.  If you haven't seen of or heard of the chocolate cake shake that they offer at Portillos, you need to head over and grab one for yourself ASAP! It's just as you imagine, a chocolate shake with bits of chocolate cake in it, and little pieces of icing and cream in every gulp. I'm not even that big of a fan of chocolate and I always get it when I go. If you're not even hungry and want a good shake, this is the place to go to! It's also a plus that they have a drive thru so you don't have to go down and place and order and wait for it to be made.   Food = 3/5 Shakes = 5/5

LpOhtnnd2id1ptcrR37mNQ.text: Portillo's has everything, not just hot dogs.  This was my first time there, since I really don't like hot dogs much so wasn't in any hurry.  Big mistake!  I addition to hot dogs, I saw they had a pretty big salad set up (not just a token salad or 2), italian beef, different sausages, pasta, ribs, burgers, chicken sandwiches, chicken tenders...    I got a chili cheese dog (I know, right?!) and onion rings.  Both were great!  And I'll be back in the not so far future to try their other menu items.   It's a little confusing when you first walk in where to go.  Go all the way back to the corner by the salad station and order at the register.  Service is very friendly and helpful.  Food came out in just a few minutes.  They could use more tables inside because even though it wasn't very crowded most of the tables were full, but the tables were all clean and the place is kept up pretty nicely.    Portillo's is a welcome addition to this part of town as a reasonably priced place that has something for everyone.

MAlV1M8djUT0pp-ePKRc7w.text: Ever since they opened this location, we've been coming here regularly. We usually order same things but sometimes we try different things here and there. And so far everything has been really tasty. Italian beef is delicious, onion rings are crunch, and crinkle fries are just perfectly seasoned. Tried a strawberry malt it's really really delicious. Their chocolate cake is the bomb too.

XsHKg54vUnbVAlaYBD3p_w.text: We've been twice and have NO reason to return.  Have had a variety of items in menu, none of which are worth ordering again.  I have no idea what the allure is.

GbZmiCw_XVgX5aAGgDdwyw.text: Be prepared to be whisked (rushed) into line with barely a moment to review the menu, although this is how they manage to serve so many people so quickly (which they do well).  We were standing off to the side, trying to decide what to order and were "told" to move into line to order long before we were ready.  There didn't appear to be anywhere you could stand in order to take your time deciding what you want.  Being new to this restaurant, we found that a stressful way to begin a dining experience.    The food is tasty and price is good.  The Chocolate Cake Shake is WOW!!!  A rich, creamy shaky with bits of chocolate cake mixed in.  SUPER YUMMY!!   For a fast food place, they have a good selection of items to choose from:  nice looking salads, burgers, sausage sandwiches and, of course, the hotdogs.  I would prefer a more relaxing atmosphere (it gets pretty noisy - reminded me of Nathan's Hotdogs in NY), but wouldn't mind eating here again in  the future.

aleKIngdvZxFJq28uJCslQ.text: So excited Portillo's is finally in AZ!! Great hot dogs, Italian Beef sandwiches and salads. Can't wait to go back again and again to try everything on the menu!!!
